alert.note: Alert for Mason (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 06 at 6:05PM EDT until May 06 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central West Virginia, northern West Virginia, southern West Virginia and western West Virginia, including the following counties, in central West Virginia, Calhoun, Gilmer, Jackson and Roane. In northern West Virginia, Wirt. In southern West Virginia, Putnam. In western West Virginia, Mason. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 604 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ripley, Glenville, Grantsville, Arnoldsburg, Cedar Creek State Park, Reedy, Sand Fork, Annamoriah, Creston, Mount Zion, Millstone, Lucille, Orma, Big Springs, Stumptown, Normantown, Tanner, Leroy, Gay and Newberne. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
